Ingredients.4: 4 (15 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained

Ingredients.5: 2 (15 ounce) cans pinto beans, rinsed and drained

Ingredients.6: 1 (10 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained

Ingredients.12: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.15: 1 cup shredded reduced-fat Monterey Jack cheese

Directions.1: Combine rice, water, and taco seasoning in a saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until tender, 35 to 40 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool; it will be soggy.

Directions.2: Combine black beans, pinto beans, corn, salsa, onion, cumin, garlic powder, oregano, salt, and pepper in a large bowl; toss to mix. Mix in cooked rice, Cheddar, and Monterey Jack.

Directions.3: Divide the bean-rice mixture evenly among the tortillas and roll up.

Directions.4: Spray a cookie sheet lightly with cooking spray. Lay tortillas in a single layer on the cookie sheet and place in the freezer until fully frozen, about 2 hours. Wrap each tortilla in plastic wrap or foil and place in a large zip-top bag to store in the freezer until ready to use.
